discussion.content:
Number of Cases | Purchase date +360 | 2
Allocation type is cases (exchange the drone), not hours
End Date for this arrangement is the end of the 1 year extended warranty, so purchase date + 360 days
Total Term sets the amount of the Allocation Type = amount of allowed exchange cases = 2
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/create-entitlement-define-support-terms-customer?tabs=customerserviceadmincenter

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

An online drone retailer uses Dynamics 365 Customer Service. The company uses Customer Service Hub and cases to manage their product warranty and return policies.

Customers that purchase a one-year extended warranty for a drone can exchange it twice for another model. To qualify, an exchange must occur within 30 days, on the condition that the drone has less than 100 hours of flight.

You need to configure the system.

Which setting should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
Think about it this way, if the queue is not working you can create as many new queues as you want, if they are configure the same way, they will have the same issue, therefore is a config issue.

Selected Answer: B
A. Configure queue item views: This would allow you to see the items in the queue, but it doesnâ€™t necessarily solve the issue of automatic assignment.

B. Configure the queue: This could potentially solve the issue if the problem lies within the configuration of the queue itself.

C. Create five new queues: If each SLA requires a unique queue for proper routing and assignment, creating new queues could resolve the issue.

D. Create a view for the outstanding requests: This would help in monitoring the outstanding requests but may not resolve the issue of automatic assignment.

So I would pick B. because despite the fact that doesn't offer a direct fix, it allows actions to be perfomed to fix the issue

I hope that's not how it is phrased in exams... if you configure the routing one paramente is the queue, so the queue should be already created.
Maybe D. create a view for outstanding requests can be the correct one if the outstanding requests are the ones without any SLA, and so you monitor them - does it solve the issue, well i wouldn't say, i would say that you solve the issue when all requests are assigned to queues.
A. is not ok, bc if there would be the queue item requests would be visible in the queue.
B. configuring the queue is so generic that could mean anything and so it could be possible too...
Or maybe there is something that i'm missing...

choices.D: Create a view for the outstanding requests.

questions.question_text:
A repair company offers five types of service-level agreements (SLAs). Customers can choose an SLA when they purchase a service contract. You define routing and assignment rules to support the SLAs.

A service manager observes that outstanding service requests are not being automatically assigned by the routing rules.

You need to resolve the issue.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/administer/configure-work-classification

In the first section: <<Typically, rules are written in the format of "if defined condition satisfies, then set the output attributes to certain values>>

So, also in my opinion the first should be Work Classification
I think the first one is Work classification - as it can classify the work based on given information and update the priority. Second one is Prioritisation

comments.content: I mean the second question is wrong: Assignment order....

discussion.content: Wrong answer, it is Work classification: Work classification specifically addresses the need to assign work based on agent capacity, ensuring that agents are not overloaded and that work is distributed evenly.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Customer Service. Incoming case records are assigned to queues.

Cases need to be assigned to employees based on predetermined criteria.

You need to determine which routing rules to configure.

Which routing rules should you configure?

To answer, drag the appropriate rule types to the correct needs. Each rule type may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

questions.question_text:
Which three capabilities are included in Dynamics 365 Marketing? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

DRAG DROP
-

All employees at a company use Office 365. You are setting up Dynamics 365 Sales for the company. Only some employees will have licenses for Dynamics 365 Sales.

You need to recommend solutions for the company.

What should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate solutions to the correct requirements. Each solution may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

//IMG//

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

comments.content: Yes, this is an update to the other question. the options there was Microsoft Dataverse which i think have been deprecated and now we have Dual-Right which is the correct option
